meanings.definition: Engaged in too many activities or tasks
meanings.sent1: She felt overbusy trying to finish all her homework in one night.
meanings.sent2: The overbusy streets of the city made it hard to navigate.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel looked overbusy gathering nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like an overbusy beehive, buzzing with thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The overbusy schedule left no time for relaxation or fun.

meanings.sent1: The overbusy schedule left him feeling exhausted.
meanings.sent2: The overbusy restaurant struggled to keep up with orders.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed overbusy chasing its tail in circles.
meanings.sent4: The overbusy market was a hive of activity and noise.
meanings.sent5: Her overbusy mind raced with worries and to-do lists.
